docs.lead_paragraph: After some painful losses — the 2004 election, Ted Kennedy’s death — Senator John Kerry is in a position of influence again.

docs.lead_paragraph: Hillary Rodham Clinton has pursued initiatives to help women gain political power, personal safety and enough money to help their communities and countries transition to democracy.

docs.lead_paragraph: A report in the Prescriptions column on Monday about the Senate health care debate misstated the proportion of the population, including Medicare beneficiaries age 65 and over, that would be covered by 2019 if proposed legislation is adopted. It would be about 94 percent, according to the Congressional Budget Office; counting people age 65 and older would not make the projected total 98 percent.
docs.abstract: Correction of Nov 23 article about Senate health care debate that misstated proportion of population that would be covered by 2019 if proposed legislation is adopted

docs.lead_paragraph: The National Farmers Union is not the only one aiming its message at Senators Blanche Lincoln and Ben Nelson over the public option. Despite pleas from the White House, some Democratic activists are gearing up for a renewed onslaught against those senators and others in the health care debate. Democracy for America, the liberal grass-roots political action committee founded by Howard Dean, the former chairman of the Democratic National Committee and governor of Vermont, is appealing for money to continue its campaign against what it calls ''insurance industry Democrats.''
docs.abstract: Some Democratic activists are gearing up for renewed lobbying effort aimed at swing-vote senators and others in health-care debate; Democracy for America is appealing for money to continue campaign against what it calls insurance industry Democrats; photos (M)

docs.lead_paragraph: NELSON--Brian Anthony, of Brooklyn, NY, died November 22. Born in Bronxville, NY on December 13, 1958, he moved with his father and brother Craig to London in 1962. He was educated at Edge Grove and Sherborne in England, and graduated from the University of Vermont in 1980. Suffering from kidney failure because of diabetes and nephritis, he was unable to pursue a career in his first love, the theater. For twelve years he was a successful insurance agent, then took an MBA in theater management at Columbia University. In spite of deteriorating health, he subsequently worked both on and off Broadway. Brian was long a member of the Amateur Comedy Club, where he both acted and directed with distinction. The club became his extended family and he was made an honorary life member in 2008. Brian contracted cancer in 2004 and was faced with impossible odds, which he fought, as always, with unfailing bravery and humor. His recent blog posts about his struggle can be seen at briananelson.blogspot.com or by searching well.blogs.nytimes.com. He is mourned and greatly missed by his wife, Diane, his parents Merlin and Janet, his brothers Craig and Rolf and his sister Claudia. A service will be held at the Cathedral of St. John the Divine in December on a date to be announced.

headline.main: Paid Notice: Deaths  NELSON, BRIAN ANTHONY

docs.lead_paragraph: In a telephone news conference aimed at pressuring swing-vote senators, leaders of the National Farmers Union on Tuesday underscored the importance of health care legislation to agricultural workers in Arkansas, Maine and Nebraska. And the necessary provisions, said the group, which represents about 250,000 farming and ranching families, include a government-run health insurance plan, or public option, that would compete with private insurers.
docs.abstract: National Farmers Union holds telephone press conference intended to pressure swing-state senators to support health care reform legislation; says legislation is vital to its roughly 250,000 members; calls for government-run insurance plan, or public option (M)

docs.lead_paragraph: CNN responded Tuesday to criticism about one of its political commentators, Alex Castellanos, by saying it maintained the same policy for him that it has had for other paid political analysts.

headline.main: CNN Explains Policy on Political Consultants

docs.abstract: CNN said its policy toward the political commentator Alex Castellanos was consistent with past practices.
docs.snippet: CNN said its policy toward the political commentator Alex Castellanos was consistent with past practices.

docs.lead_paragraph: Despite pleas from the White House, some Democratic activists are gearing up for a renewed onslaught against Democrats.
docs.abstract: The liberal Democratic group founded by Howard Dean is waging a campaign against Democratic lawmakers deemed too friendly to insurers.
docs.snippet: The liberal Democratic group founded by Howard Dean is waging a campaign against Democratic lawmakers deemed too friendly to insurers.

docs.lead_paragraph: Overview | What values are evident in the policy proposals coming out of the current health care debate? How do our own values shape our views on health care reform? How do the proposals now pending in Congress compare? In this lesson, students express their views about the pending health care reform and examine comparisons of the House and Senate bills.

headline.main: Where Do You Stand? Responding to the Pending Health Care Legislation

docs.abstract: Lesson Plan | Considering the values inherent in the debate over health care reform and comparing the proposals in Congress.
docs.snippet: Lesson Plan | Considering the values inherent in the debate over health care reform and comparing the proposals in Congress.
